titleStmt.title: W. D. Newman et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6009

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Dec 5th 18,64
Honerable Thomas, E. Bramlette Gov of the commonwealth of Ky

I Waddy Thompson of the county of Metcalfe and state of Kentucky haveing been Indited in the Metcalfe circuit court for the offence of Keeping a Tipling house after my Licens had expired and haveing confessed Judgement in the Metca^l^fe circuit court at its December term 1864 in the sum of Sixty dollars

Now we the undersigned citizens of Metcalfe county Ky would Respectfully ask your remittance of said fine as we are satesfied from every circumstance and from the acquaintance that we have with the said Waddy Thompson that he did not commit the above ^stated^ offence with any intention or desire to violate the laws of the commonwealth of Kentucky he being a good loyal man and a law abideing citizen and respectable man we earnestly request your consideration and remittance of said fine if consistant with your feelings after consideration of the matter

W. D. Newman
James Mitchell
James L. Strange
capt co G 54 Ky vols
Thos. Ball P,M.
J. H. C. Surridge
Tho. E. Young C M C C
C. C. Harvey
P. S. Rush Dept. Pro. Mar
Dr J. C. Green
Geo. A. Clark Sheriff
of Metcalfe County

Wm, J, Masters Col 81st Reg Ky militia
J, H, Bead Deputy Sheriff Metcalfe County
J W Ball Assistant Post Master
T. L. Anderson
St.clair Walker a Juror.
S. J. Walker
James G. Gilley. a Juror
R. T. Franklin a Juror
J. A. Thompson
Joseph Stark a Militia capt
John Ball
M, B, Wallace
S. H. Flint

Metcalfe Cir Ct
vs
Waddy Thompson
$60,
28 Aug/65
